name: Rice
description: Rice is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population.
soilInfo: Loamy soil, clayey loam, and clayey soil are the best for growing rice.
growthConditions: Requires high temperature, high humidity, and an annual rainfall of above 100 cm.

name: Wheat
description: Wheat is a grass widely cultivated for its seed, a cereal grain which is a worldwide staple food.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy and clayey soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
growthConditions: Requires cool, moist weather during the growing period and warm, dry weather during harvest.

name: Maize
description: Maize is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago.
soilInfo: Well-drained, fertile soils with a pH range of 5.8 to 7.8.
growthConditions: Requires warm weather with temperatures between 21°C and 30°C.

name: Barley
description: Barley is a major cereal grain grown in temperate climates globally.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
growthConditions: Requires cool and dry weather, particularly during the growing season.

name: Millets
description: Millets are a group of highly variable small-seeded grasses, widely grown around the world as cereal crops.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy to sandy soils with a pH range of 5.5 to 7.0.
growthConditions: Requires hot and dry weather, suitable for arid and semi-arid regions.

name: Sorghum
description: Sorghum is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family Poaceae.
soilInfo: Sorghum grows well in sandy loam to loam soils.
growthConditions: Requires warm temperatures and is tolerant to drought conditions.

name: Soybean
description: Soybean is a species of legume native to East Asia, widely grown for its edible bean.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.
growthConditions: Requires warm weather, with temperatures between 20°C and 30°C.

name: Groundnut
description: Groundnut, also known as peanut, is a legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds.
soilInfo: Light sandy loam soils with good drainage.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with 20°C to 30°C temperature.

name: Cotton
description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of cotton plants.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 5.8 to 8.0.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with temperatures between 21°C and 30°C.

name: Sugarcane
description: Sugarcane is a tropical, perennial grass that forms lateral shoots at the base to produce multiple stems.
soilInfo: Deep, rich loamy soil with good drainage.
growthConditions: Requires hot and humid climate with temperatures between 20°C and 40°C.

name: Tea
description: Tea is an aromatic beverage commonly prepared by pouring hot or boiling water over cured or fresh tea leaves.
soilInfo: Deep, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 4.5 to 5.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm and humid climate with well-distributed rainfall.

name: Coffee
description: Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with moderate rainfall and temperatures between 15°C and 25°C.

name: Banana
description: Banana is an edible fruit, botanically a berry, produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants.
soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with good moisture content.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with high humidity and well-distributed rainfall.

name: Mango
description: Mango is a juicy stone fruit produced from numerous species of tropical trees belonging to the flowering plant genus Mangifera.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy to sandy loam soils.
growthConditions: Requires warm, dry weather during flowering and fruit setting and hot, humid weather during fruit development.

name: Papaya
description: Papaya is the fruit of the plant Carica papaya, and is one of the 22 accepted species in the genus Carica of the family Caricaceae.
soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with well-distributed rainfall and temperatures between 21°C and 33°C.

name: Pineapple
description: Pineapple is a tropical plant with an edible fruit and the most economically significant plant in the family Bromeliaceae.
soilInfo: Well-drained, sandy loam soils with a pH range of 4.5 to 6.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm and humid climate with temperatures between 23°C and 32°C.

name: Apple
description: Apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree, which is cultivated worldwide as a fruit tree, and is the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
growthConditions: Requires cold climate with temperatures between 21°C and 24°C.

name: Grapes
description: Grapes are a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.
soilInfo: Deep, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 7.
growthConditions: Requires warm and dry climate with temperatures between 15°C and 35°C.

name: Orange
description: Orange is the fruit of various citrus species in the family Rutaceae; it primarily refers to Citrus × sinensis, which is also called sweet orange.
soilInfo: Well-drained sandy loam soils with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm climate with well-distributed rainfall and temperatures between 13°C and 28°C.

name: Lemon
description: Lemon is a species of small evergreen tree in the flowering plant family Rutaceae, native to South Asia, primarily North eastern India.
soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 5.5 to 6.5.
growthConditions: Requires warm, humid climate with well-distributed rainfall and temperatures between 17°C and 27°C.
